instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Performance Input Method' contain?
output: This alpha field contains the method by which the user will specify fluid cooler performance: 'UFactorTimesAreaAndDesignWaterFlowRate' 'StandardDesignCapacity' or 'UserSpecifiedDesignCapacity'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Evaporative Coolers -> text
input: What does the 'Recirculating Water Pump Design Power' field represent?
output: This numeric field is the recirculating and spray pump electric power at the Primary Design Air Flow Rate in watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text
input: What does the subsection 'Daylighting Modeling Options' describe?
output: The subsection 'Daylighting Modeling Options' describes what input objects/fields to use to model different daylighting options and gives the name of an example input if available that demonstrates the option.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What is shown in the figure 'Illustration of continuous dimming relationship'?
output: The figure shows the relationship between electric light output and electrical input.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Python Plugins / Python EMS -> text
input: What does a user need to do to create a derived class for a plugin?
output: The user will create a derived class that inherits the base class and writes custom functions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is ignored in autosizing?
output: The rated temperatures are ignored in autosizing. These are used only when the user is specifying coil performance using the NominalCapacity input method.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Hybrid Model -> text
input: What is recommended for inputting the time-series measurements in the Field: Zone Measured Air Temperature Schedule Name?
output: A Schedule:File object is recommended for inputting the time-series measurements.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the optional numeric input field specify for the Mode # Minimum Outdoor Air Temperature?
output: This optional numeric input field specifies the minimum outdoor air temperature at which Mode # is allowed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What should the total cooling capacity be considered as?
output: The total cooling capacity should be a gross i.e. the effect of supply air fan heat NOT accounted for.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' in the Refrigeration:CompressorList?
output: A unique user-assigned name for an instance of a compressor list. Any reference to this compressor list by another object will use this name. The compressor list cannot have the same name as any individual compressor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Starting Z Coordinate' for underground walls?
output: This field is the Z coordinate (in meters).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is the pressure rise of the fan in pascals?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: When is the water condenser volume flow rate field used?
output: This field is only used for water-cooled systems.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What additional information is required for each node in the AirflowNetwork:Distribution:Linkage?
output: In addition the relative height from node height to linkage height for each node is required.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What must the sum of the fractions in the 'Fraction of Input Converted to Radiant Energy' field be less than or equal to?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text

output: Up to 20 pairs of surface names and corresponding fractions may be entered for a single radiant heater system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> equation
input: What is the equation for fan power if the performance input method is 'NominalCapacity'?
output: Fan power = 0.0105\\cdot Tower\\;Nominal\\;Capacity

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is 'Zone Mixing Total Heat Loss Energy [J]'?
output: The total heat loss due to the sum of mixing cross-mixing and refrigeration-door mixing that occurs when the sum of Zone Mixing Sensible Heat Gain Energy and Zone Mixing Latent Heat Gain Energy is less than the sum of Zone Mixing Sensible Heat Loss Energy and Zone Mixing Latent Heat Loss Energy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Heating Coil Electricity Energy [J]' field represent?
output: This field is the electric consumption of the heating coil auxiliaries in Joules over the timestep being reported (e.g. inducer fan).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the outdoor air relative humidity determined?
output: The outdoor air relative humidity is inherited from the associated outdoor air node in each timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What happens when the Advanced algorithm is selected?
output: The difference between the two modified wind pressure coefficients are output to the .eio file.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the Field: Condenser Refrigerant Operating Charge Inventory specify?
output: This numeric field specifies the amount of refrigerant present within the condenser (kg) specified by the manufacturer under standard rating conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Demand Limiting Controls -> text
input: What does the 'Rotation Duration' field determine?
output: If the RotateOne or RotateMany option is used for Selection Control this field sets the time interval [minutes] between rotations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: The results are summed for the timestep being reported and added to a meter with Resource Type = Water End Use Key = Cooling Group Key = System.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the Green Roof Current Runoff Depth?
output: Cumulative or current runoff (m). Multiply by roof area to get volume.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the effective EIR calculated using the part load fraction correlation?
output: The product of the rated EIR and EIR modifier curves is divided by the output of the part load fraction correlation curve to give the effective EIR.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: Why are controls not attached directly to a particular component in EnergyPlus?
output: The input can be simplified by entering node names to be controlled avoiding the need to search through multiple lists of component types for the sake of simply controlling components.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: When should SupplyAirHumidityRatio be used for the Zone Latent Cooling Design Supply Air Humidity Ratio Input Method?
output: Use SupplyAirHumidityRatio to enter the humidity ratio when zone dehumidification is required.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How are the latent parts of exfiltration determined?
output: The latent parts are determined by taking the difference between the total and the sensible rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the back side solar reflectance at normal incidence for the window material described?
output: The back side solar reflectance at normal incidence is 0.3192.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What is one application of the differential thermostat?
output: One application of the differential thermostat is to ensure a useful heat gain for solar heating systems i.e. the system is only turned on when there is a significant temperature difference between the solar collector outlet node and the storage tank outlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What values are required in the 'Ventilation Control Mode Schedule Name' schedule?
output: The integer values are required in the schedule and should be varied between 0 and 7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: How is part-load operation represented in the model?
output: The model assumes that part-load operation is represented by a simple linear interpolation between two steady-state regimes (i.e. tower fan at high speed for the entire simulation timestep and tower fan at low speed).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: HVAC: Primary and Secondary Systems -> text
input: How many portions are there to the HVAC simulation in EnergyPlus?
output: In EnergyPlus there are several portions to the HVAC simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> table or table row: Variable dictionary

output: The unit for Site Outdoor Air Humidity Ratio is kgWater/kgAir.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> Section: Curve:Linear -> text
input: What optional inputs may be used for the linear curve?
output: Optional inputs for curve minimum and maximum may be used to limit the output of the performance curve (e.g. limit extrapolation).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What does a schedule value of less than or equal to 0 indicate?
output: A schedule value of less than or equal to 0 indicates that the unit is off for that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Path -> text
input: What should be noted about the extensibility of the AirLoopHVAC:ZoneMixer object?
output: This object is extensible so additional fields of this type can be added to the end of this object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What is the behavior of zone humidity level for choices other than Sensible Load Only No Latent Load?
output: For all other choices the zone humidity level will be controlled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Schedules -> text
input: What should the 'Name' field in Schedule:Week:Daily contain?
output: This field should contain a unique (within all WeekSchedules) designation for this schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: How accurate is the approximation of view factors with the CarrollMRT algorithm for enclosed prism shapes?
output: The approximation is very accurate for enclosed prism shapes.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What does a subsurface multiplier represent in the Airflow Network?
output: A subsurface multiplier may be used to represent multiple subsurfaces and calculates total air flow when the subsurface (window glassdoor or door) is either closed or open.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: How does the program calculate the heating supply air volume flow rate when using FlowPerFloorArea?
output: The program calculates the heating supply air volume flow rate from the heated or cooled floor area served by the air loop and the Flow Per Unit Area value specified by the user.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the predicted sensible load to setpoint heat transfer rate used?
output: This value is used as a soft inequality constraint in the constrained optimization problem that determines system settings in each time step.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group ExternalInterface -> text
input: What is the purpose of the ExternalInterface in EnergyPlus?
output: The ExternalInterface allows coupling EnergyPlus to the Building Controls Virtual Test Bed (BCVTB). It supports the import of Functional Mock-up Units (FMUs) for co-simulation as well as the export of EnergyPlus as a FMU for co-simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does 'Refrigeration Compressor Rack Evaporative Condenser Water Volume' indicate?
output: This is the water consumed by evaporation in m³ while providing evaporative cooling of the compressor rack condenser for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> listing
input: What is the heating design capacity method for VRFDesignSpec1?
output: The heating design capacity method is HeatingDesignCapacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: What must be true about the value entered for Stage 4 Heating Temperature Offset?
output: The value entered here must be less than the value at the previous field: Stage 4 Heating Temperature Offset.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: In which zones will mixing and infiltration adjustments be made?
output: Mixing and infiltration adjustments will only be made in zones which have zone mixing or infiltration objects defined in the input.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: Where is the consumption of Chiller Heater Cooling Electricity metered?
output: Consumption is metered on Cooling:Electricity Electricity:Plant and Electricity:Facility.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> text
input: What is the value of the mass flow rate at the Inlet to Plant Loop on the supply side?
output: This is the value of the mass flow rate at the Inlet to Plant Loop on the supply side.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: How is the reset rule determined for the Outdoor Air Reset Setpoint Manager?
output: The reset rule is determined by 2 points: the setpoint temperature at the outdoor air high temperature (TSetAtOAHigh) and the setpoint temperature at the outdoor air low temperature (TSetAtOALow).

input: What is the coefficient 3 of the Full Load Ratio Curve?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: What is a complete zone thermostat example?
output: A complete zone thermostat example includes zone control objects control type objects schedule type definitions control type schedule definition heating setpoint schedule definition and cooling setpoint schedule definition.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Is defrosting energy included in the zone energy balance?
output: No it is not included.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: Under what conditions will the pump bank operate and select a flow between the minimum and maximum limits?
output: For any other condition such as the loop having a load and the pump bank is operating intermittently or the pump bank is continuously operating (regardless of the loading condition) the bank will operate and select a flow somewhere between the minimum and maximum limits.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Path -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' in the AirLoopHVAC:DedicatedOutdoorAirSystem?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: Is the 'Design Entering Air Wet-bulb Temperature' field required for both performance input methods?
output: Yes it must be specified for both the performance input methods.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What does an arrow from object A to object B mean in the context of AirflowNetwork objects?
output: An arrow from object A to object B means A references B i.e. one of the inputs in A is the name of object B.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> listing

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Heat Reclaim Recovery Efficiency' define?
output: This numeric field defines the ratio of recovered waste heat from the superheated refrigerant gas to the total rejected waste heat from the heating source (as if no heat reclaim occurred).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the 'Ice Thermal Storage End Fraction'?
output: The fraction of full ice storage which is present at the end of the current HVAC timestep. When reported at a frequency less than detailed this value is averaged over the reporting period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

input: What is the default value for the 'Field: Rated Fan Power' if left blank?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Cooling Coil Basin Heater Electricity Energy [J]' output represent?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: How is the Site Ground Temperature reported?
output: The ground temperature is reported in degrees C -- this is a user-specified input by month.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the Heat Recovery Capacity Modifier Function of Temperature Curve Name field specify?
output: This field is the name of a bivariate curve or table that defines an available capacity modifier of the unit as a function of the load side outlet temperature and the heat recovery side inlet temperature. The temperatures are in degrees Celsius when used in the function and the output of the function is multiplied by the reference capacity to get a current available capacity when the unit is operating in heat recovery mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> listing
input: What is an example input for a mechanical subcooler?
output: REFRIGERATION:SUBCOOLER SampleMSC !Subcooler Name Mechanical !subcooler type  !design liquid suction subcooling C  !design inlet temperature on liquid side C  !design inlet temperature on vapor side C MediumTempSystem !Refrigeration System Detailed Name providing cooling capacity 10; !Control Temperature Out for subcooled liquid C

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What should be entered in the Wind Exposure field if the surface is exposed to the wind?
output: If the surface is exposed to the Wind then 'WindExposed' should be entered in this field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What does the lights electricity energy include?
output: The lighting electrical consumption including ballasts if present. This will have the same value as Lights Total Heating Energy (above).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the Design Chilled Water Outlet Temperature?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Water to Air Heat Pump Fan Availability Status []' output field represent?
output: This is the availability status of the zone water source heat pump fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the Exhaust Air Heat Gain Node Name?
output: Name of the exhaust air node for this heat gain.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the defrost energy input ratio function of temperature curve name field define?
output: This alpha field defines the name of a bi-quadratic performance curve that parameterizes the variation of the energy input ratio during reverse-cycle defrost periods as a function of the wet-bulb temperature of the air entering the indoor coil and the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the default value for the subcooler effectiveness?
output: The default value for the subcooler effectiveness is 0.4.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is not required for AirCooled and EvaporativelyCooled condensers?
output: AirCooled and EvaporativelyCooled do not require a CondenserLoop to be specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the total area of stock doors facing a particular zone?
output: The total area of stock doors facing this particular zone is measured in square meters. The default is 0.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What do FIC TBFIC Rload and AT_air represent in the Fuel Input Curve?
output: FIC represents the Fuel Input Curve Coefficients TBFIC represents the Temperature Based Fuel Input Curve Coefficients Rload is the Ratio of Load to Combustion Turbine Engine Capacity and AT_air is the difference between the current ambient and design ambient temperatures.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What should the 'Field: Begin Month' contain?
output: This numeric field should contain the starting month number (1 = January 2 = February etc.) for the annual run period desired.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Divider Inside Projection' refer to?
output: It refers to the amount by which the divider projects inward from the inside surface of the window glazing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Unitary System Ancillary Electricity Rate' output field represent?
output: This output field is the average auxiliary electricity consumption rate (including both on-cycle and off-cycle) in Watts for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What does the simple airflow group consist of?
output: The simple airflow group consists of the ZoneVentilation;* and ZoneMixing objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table: Zone HVAC Equipment
input: What parameter follows 'No Load Outdoor Air Flow Rate' for ZoneHVAC:PackagedTerminalHeatPump?
output: Maximum Supply Air Temperature from Supplemental Heater

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the 'Horizontal Insulation' field indicate?
output: This alpha field indicates whether horizontal insulation is present.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: When is the 'Recovery Capacity per Unit' field used?
output: This field is only used if the Design Mode is 'PerUnit'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the output variable represent for the Heating Coil Source Side Mass Flow Rate?
output: The output variable is the average water mass flow rate going through the heat pump over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text
input: What are the valid choices for the 'Object Type' field?
output: The valid choices are Fan:OnOff Fan:ConstantVolume and Fan:VariableVolume.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Performance Tables -> table row: Table:IndependentVariableList
input: What are the values for iv1 iv2 and iv3 in the eighteenth row of the table?
output: The values are iv1[3] iv2[1] iv3[2] and the output is out[3][1][2].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Output Unit Type' field?
output: This field is used to indicate the kind of units that may be associated with the output values. It is used by IDF Editor to display the appropriate SI and IP units for the Minimum Curve Output and Maximum Curve Output.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What must be specified as AirflowNetwork:Distribution:Nodes?
output: All nodes used to define an AirLoopHVAC (except splitters mixers and outdoor air systems which are treated as single nodes) and its connections to a thermal zone must be specified as AirflowNetwork:Distribution:Nodes.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the output 'Zone Mixing Volume [m3]'?
output: The air volume in m³ entering the zone due to the sum of mixing cross-mixing and refrigeration-door mixing during the hour or timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the output of the dehumidifying setpoint value?
output: The output is the average over the reporting period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the field 'Chilled Water Outlet Node Name' contain?
output: This required alpha field contains the identifying name for the chiller plant side outlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the 'Water Heater Final Tank Temperature [C]'?
output: The final water tank temperature at the end of the system timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Load Side Inlet Node Name' contain?
output: This alpha field contains the heat pump's load side inlet node name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: What is the purpose of a thermostat that can perform both heating and cooling?
output: This would be for heating and cooling thermostat but only heating or cooling can be scheduled at any given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: How is a kitchen zone with an exhaust fan designed to draw its makeup air?
output: A kitchen zone with an exhaust fan is designed to draw half of its makeup air from a neighboring dining room and the other half from the outdoor air system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Input Unit Type for Y' field?
output: This field is used to indicate the kind of units that may be associated with the y values. It is used by IDF Editor to display the appropriate SI and IP units for the Minimum Value of Y and Maximum Value of Y. The unit conversion is not applied to the coefficients.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What can the BuildingSurface:Detailed object describe?
output: The BuildingSurface:Detailed object can more generally describe each of the surfaces.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> listing
input: What is the IDF example for attached shading surfaces?
output: The IDF example includes specifications for overhangs and fins with details such as surface names base surface names shadowing transmittance schedules and vertex coordinates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the unit of the Refrigeration Air Chiller System Condenser Evaporated Water Volume Flow Rate?
output: The unit is cubic meters per second (m3/s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Input -- Output Descriptions (Document) -> text
input: What is another example of a variable from the eplusout.rdd file?
output: ZoneAverageSite Outdoor Air Humidity Ratio [kgWater/kgAir]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the back side slat beam-diffuse visible transmittance of the WindowMaterial:Blind:EquivalentLayer?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What does a schedule value of 1 denote in the Inlet Air Mixer schedule?
output: A schedule value equal to 1 denotes that the heat pump draws its inlet air from outdoors.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> text
input: What does the 'Hole Layout Pattern for Pitch' field describe?
output: This field is used to describe the pattern of perforations in the collector surface.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: What is the default comfort height?
output: The default is 1.1 meters.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does a schedule value less than or equal to 0 indicate?
output: A schedule value less than or equal to 0 (usually 0 is used) denotes that the outdoor air unit must be off for the time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the cooling tower heat transfer rate represent?
output: This is the rate at which heat is removed from the condenser water loop by the tower.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What was the TARP algorithm developed for?
output: The TARP algorithm was developed for the TARP software and combines natural and wind-driven convection correlations from laboratory measurements on flat plates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Water Heater Tank Type?
output: WaterHeater:Mixed

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the Convergence tolerance?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What does the Heat Exchanger Total Heating Rate indicate?
output: This output is the total heating rate of the process air by the heat exchanger in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the calculation based on?
output: The calculation is based on log-mean temperature difference (LMTD) and includes the heat transfer effectiveness factor entered above.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What is the field 'Minimum Process Inlet Air Humidity Ratio for Humidity Ratio Equation'?
output: The minimum allowable value of PWI in the humidity ratio equation shown above (kgWater/kgDryAir).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What happens if the inlet water temperature exceeds the maximum allowed temperature in the 'Maximum Inlet Water Temperature for Heat Reclaim' field?
output: Heat reclaim is restricted so that the tank water does not exceed this temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the output 'Refrigeration Air Chiller System Estimated Refrigerant Inventory Mass [kg]' represent?
output: This output is the sum of the input inventory values for the condenser receiver cases and liquid pipes that are a part of this system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What should be specified if the heat exchanger does not transfer latent energy for the Latent Effectiveness at 100% Heating Air Flow field?
output: Specify this value as 0.0 if the heat exchanger does not transfer latent energy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: Where is the zone terminal unit list used?
output: The zone terminal unit list is used exclusively in the variable refrigerant flow (VRF) air conditioner object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What does the note about surfaces in the simulated building indicate?
output: Surfaces which are part of the simulated building automatically shade other parts of the building as geometry and time of day dictate so there is no need for the user to include surfaces that might be in other zones for shading.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' in the ZoneCapacitanceMultiplier:ResearchSpecial object?
output: The name of the ZoneCapacitanceMultiplier:ResearchSpecial object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What are the allowed inputs for the Cooling Design Air Flow Method field?
output: Allowed inputs are None SupplyAirFlowRate FlowPerFloorArea FractionOfAutosizedCoolingAirflow or FlowPerCoolingCapacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Air Outlet Node Name' define?
output: This alpha field defines the name of the HVAC system node to which the DX heating coil sends its outlet air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What is the unbalanced air flow?
output: The unbalanced air flow is the difference between the current flow rate and the balanced flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What can the value of the 'Power per Floor Area' be if the None fuel type is selected?
output: This value can be negative to denote a loss if the None fuel type is selected otherwise this must be positive.

input: What is the Speed 9 Reference Unit Gross Heating Capacity?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> table row: Outdoor Air Controller Limiting Factors
input: What does a value of 1 indicate for the outdoor air flow rate limiting factor?
output: 1 = Limits and Scheduled Limits: Fixed limits such as Controller:OutdoorAir Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate Maximum Outdoor Air Flow Rate Minimum Fraction of Outdoor Air Schedule Name Maximum Fraction of Outdoor Air Schedule Name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What does the schedule value 4 indicate in the ventilation control mode?
output: 4 = Outdoor ventilation air control. The outdoor ventilation air control works with AirflowNetwork opening objects only and is not allowed to work with ZoneVentilation:* and ZoneMixing objects. If the zone air change per hour (ACH) level is above the outdoor air setpoint specified in the Minimum Outdoor Ventilation Air Schedule Name field the natural ventilation is on and the HVAC system is shut off. Otherwise the natural ventilation is shut off (i.e. the window or door openings are closed) and the HVAC system may operate if needed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is Zone Ideal Loads Outdoor Air Total Heating Rate expressed?
output: Zone Ideal Loads Outdoor Air Total Heating Rate is expressed in Watts (W).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the input unit type for y in the MinSpdPower?
output: Dimensionless

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What is the role of the pressure rise in the fan system?
output: It is used to determine the heat added to the air stream as a result of the work done by the fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What does the 'Capacity at High Temperature' field specify?
output: This is the baseboard equipment capacity (Watts) at the high temperature limit and is autosizable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> table or table row: Variable dictionary
input: What is the unit for Site Wind Direction?
output: The unit for Site Wind Direction is degrees [deg].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Equipment -> text
input: What is the purpose of the ZoneHVAC:AirDistributionUnit?
output: The ZoneHVAC:AirDistributionUnit allows equipment typically found within the zone inlet ductwork (such as dampers reheat coils etc.) to be attached to the supply air stream for a particular zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What effect does sunlight absorption have on thermochromic windows?
output: The more sunlight a thermochromic window absorbs the lower the light level going through it.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: Under what condition is the 'Field: Storage Capacity per Floor Area' used?
output: This field is only used if the Design Mode is \PerFloorArea\.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text
input: What does the Field: Enthalpy Sensor Offset define in the FaultModel:EnthalpySensorOffset:OutdoorAir?
output: This field defines the offset of the enthalpy sensor. A positive value means the sensor reads an enthalpy that is higher than the real value. A negative value means the sensor reads an enthalpy that is lower than the real value. A 0.0 value means no offset. Default is 0.0. The units are in J/kg.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the result from the cubic curve multiplied by?
output: The result from the cubic curve is multiplied by the difference between the rated ambient relative humidity and the actual zone relative humidity and one minus this value is multiplied by the Rated LHR to give the operating LHR at the actual zone humidity condition.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What is assumed if the VFD efficiency type field is blank?
output: If the VFD efficiency type field is blank it is assumed that the VFD efficiency is 0.97.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> text
input: What are the two possible environments in which the pipe can be placed?
output: The pipe can be placed in either 'Zone' or 'Schedule' environments.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the View Factor to Ground for a horizontal upward-facing surface?
output: The View Factor to Ground is 0.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What does a positive value indicate for inside face conduction?
output: A positive value means that the conduction is from just inside the inside face toward the inside face.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is used to calculate the default loss factor if it is not specified?
output: An empirical correlation is used to calculate the default loss factor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the Cooling Tower Fan Cycling Ratio represent?
output: This represents the fraction of a time-step when tower fan is on. The fan can cycle at both speeds.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: What does the Water System Storage Tank Overflow Water Volume indicate?
output: The Water System Storage Tank Overflow Water Volume indicates the volume of water overflowing the tank measured in cubic meters (m³).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the value calculated for each HVAC system timestep?
output: This value is calculated for each HVAC system timestep being simulated and the results (cooling only) are summed for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What does the starting corner for the surface specify?
output: The rectangular surfaces specify the lower left corner of the surface for their starting coordinate. This is specified with (xyz) and can be relative to the zone origin or in world coordinates depending on the value for rectangular surfaces specified in the GlobalGeometryRules object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is Frame Outside Projection used to calculate?
output: Frame Outside Projection is used to calculate shadowing of frame onto glass solar absorbed by frame IR emitted and absorbed by frame and convection from frame.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Schedule Name' specify?
output: It specifies the name of the schedule that modifies the lighting power design level.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: How is the Cooling Effect adjusted PMV calculated for an environment with elevated average air speed?
output: It is calculated using the adjusted average air temperature the adjusted radiant temperature and still air (0.1 m/s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> text
input: What energy is added to the air loop by solar collectors?
output: Energy added to air loop by solar collectors (Joules).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is assumed about the outdoor temperature controlled baseboard heat option?
output: The outdoor temperature controlled baseboard heat option is assumed to be fueled by electricity. This field is the same as the Baseboard Total Heating Energy (above) in joules.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What value should electronic control circuits have for the off-cycle parasitic heat fraction?
output: Electronic control circuits do not add any heat to the tank and should be 0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Performance Tables -> table row: Independent variable values
input: What are the values in the eighth row of the table?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What types of multi-skin component models are available?
output: Types of multi-skin component models that are available include unglazed transpired solar collectors ventilated photovoltaic panels and naturally ventilated facades.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text

output: The mass flux of water vapor from the deep layer of a specific surface to the surface layer of that surface. A positive flux is from the surface layer to the deep layer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Energy Management System (EMS) -> text

output: The keyword 'Electricity' selects the main meter for electricity consumption in units of Joules [J].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How many air side node connections does the heating coil have?
output: The heating coil has two air side node connections.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What does the Field: Total Design Flow Rate represent?
output: This numeric field contains the pump bank's rated volume flow rate in cubic meters per second. This is equal to the product of number of pumps and the flow rate of each individual pump. The field can be autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: This value is calculated for each HVAC system timestep and the results are averaged for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What is X in the context of the discharging voltage change equation?
output: X is the removed charge divided by the maximum capacity at a given current.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Humidifiers and Dehumidifiers -> text
input: What does a schedule value of 0 indicate in the 'Field: Availability Schedule Name'?
output: A schedule value of 0 indicates that the unit is off for that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the minimum setpoint temperature for the basin heater?
output: The set point temperature must be greater than or equal to 2˚C and the default value is 2˚C if this field is left blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What is noted about using reflection calculations?
output: Using the reflection calculations can be very time-consuming and even error-prone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Control -> text
input: What does the alpha value contain in the context of the control strategy?
output: This alpha value contains the identifying name of the control strategy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: How is crack flow assumed in the AirflowNetwork model?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
