output: \\( C_d \\) = Discharge coefficient [dimensionless]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: When is the WaterHeater:Sizing object needed?
output: This object is only needed if volume or capacity is being automatically sized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is Zone Ventilation Sensible Heat Gain Energy?
output: The sensible (temperature) heat gain that occurs when the ventilation inlet air temperature is greater than or equal to the zone air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What does the figure illustrate regarding the Building North Axis?
output: The figure illustrates how the building north axis can be rotated to correspond with one of the major axes of an actual building.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is short-wave radiation in the context of window heat flow?
output: Short-wave radiation is that from lights and interior solar radiation (beam and diffuse) incident on this window.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group ExternalInterface -> text
input: Can the 'Field: Name' duplicate any other global scope Erl variable?
output: No this name cannot duplicate any other global scope Erl variable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> text
input: How is the starting point of the air loop defined in the simulation?
output: This point is defined as two points: one that resides with the zone equipment simulation and one that is acted upon by the air loop simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What is the effect of larger 'Loop Design Temperature Difference' values?
output: Larger 'Loop Design Temperature Difference' values lead to smaller design flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: Where can you find a more detailed description of the transition from cooling only mode to heat recovery mode?
output: Refer to the engineering reference document discussion on the variable refrigerant flow heat pump model section for a more detailed description.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: How often is the latent heating rate value calculated?
output: This value is calculated for each HVAC system timestep being simulated and the results (latent heat addition only) are averaged for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Cooling And Charge Mode Charging Rated COP field specify?
output: This field is used to specify the coefficient of performance (COP) at rating conditions while operating in Cooling And Charge Mode to charge the TES.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What conditions trigger shading in the 'OnIfHighZoneAirTempAndHighSolarOnWindow' control type?
output: Shading is on if the zone air temperature exceeds the Setpoint (C) and if the solar radiation incident on the window exceeds SetPoint 2 (W/m²).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the output of the supply air temperature?
output: The output is the average over the reporting period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Starting Z Coordinate' represent?
output: It represents the Z coordinate in meters.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: How do water and control temperatures for heating work together?
output: They provide a linear function that determines the water temperature sent to the radiant system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the condition for using the 'No Load Supply Air Flow Rate Control Set To Low Speed' field?
output: If the coil type does not have multiple air flow rates then this field is not used. If Yes is selected and the coil air flow rate is autosized the No Load Supply Air Flow Rate is proportional to the number of speeds.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the independent variable for the part load fraction correlation?
output: The independent variable is the part load ratio (sensible cooling load / steady-state sensible cooling capacity).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What happens if the chiller is AirCooled or EvaporativelyCooled and the condenser side outlet node field is left blank?
output: The program automatically creates a condenser side outlet air node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: How is the mixing-volume defined?
output: As incoming volume flow from other adjacent zones where the air temperature is higher than the temperature in this zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Ventilated Slab Radiant Heating Rate' field report?
output: This field reports the radiant heating input rate of the ventilated slab system to the zone it is serving in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How is the 'Zone Air System Sensible Cooling Energy [J]' calculated?
output: It is the sensible cooling rate multiplied by the simulation timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the Key Value for the output 'Surface Inside Face Heat Balance Calculation Iteration Count'?
output: The Key Value is 'Simulation'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What should the WaterHeater Name match?
output: This name should match the name of a Water Heater:Mixed or a Water Heater:Stratified input object defined elsewhere in the input file.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Field: Name?
output: This field is a unique user assigned name for an instance of the thermal chimney system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the maximum fabric openness fraction for most drape fabric materials?
output: For most drape fabric materials the maximum fabric openness fraction does not exceed 0.2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Heat Pump Defrost Control' field specify?
output: This optional choice field specifies the defrost model as None Timed OnDemand or TimedEmpirical.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Using EnergyPlus as a Library -> text
input: What is the responsibility of the client regarding the state object?
output: The client must be a reliable courier of the state object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the 'Day of Week for Start Day' field specify?
output: It specifies the starting day of the week for the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What must be true for floor surfaces in a given zone using Foundation:Kiva objects?
output: For a given zone each floor surface must reference a different Foundation:Kiva object. Multiple foundation floor surfaces may exist in the same thermal zone so long as they reference separate Foundation:Kiva objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: EnergyPlus Output Processing -> text
input: What extension do reports with commas as delimiters have?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: What gradient is applied if zone temperatures are 26.0 C or higher?
output: It will apply a gradient of 1 K/m if zone temperatures are 26.0 C or higher.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is specified in the Field: Name for a compressor?
output: A unique user-assigned name for an instance of a compressor. Any reference to this compressor by another object will use this name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Equipment -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Name field in the ZoneHVAC:EquipmentList inputs?
output: The Name field is a unique identifying name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the minimum and maximum value for the Design Evaporator Temperature or Brine Inlet Temperature?
output: The minimum value is -70C and the maximum value is 40C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: What kind of equipment can be modeled using the Sensible Fraction Schedule and Latent Fraction Schedule fields?
output: Equipment such as showers that generate a significant heat gain can be modeled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What must be true about the node name in the 'Cooling Water Inlet Node Name' field?
output: This node name must also show up in the branch description when defining the plant demand side network in a manner identical to defining a cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: When is the parasitic load consumed according to the Off Cycle Parasitic Fuel Load field?
output: The model assumes that this parasitic load is consumed only for the portion of the simulation timestep where the boiler is not operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Demand Limiting Controls -> text
input: What happens if the All option is used?
output: If the All option is used all managers are activated simultaneously to achieve the maximum demand reduction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What does the field 'Minimum Setpoint Humidity Ratio' indicate?
output: The field 'Minimum Setpoint Humidity Ratio' indicates the minimum humidity ratio (kgWater/kgDryAir) that is allowed by this setpoint manager applicable only if the control variable is MaximumHumidityRatio MinimumHumidityRatio or HumidityRatio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> table row: Curve:Biquadratic
input: What is the Coefficient1 Constant for Spd1Cooling?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Schedules -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Field: Schedule Type Limits Name?
output: This field contains a reference to the Schedule Type Limits object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Field: Tube Outside Surface Area input specify?
output: The outside surface area (m²) of the tubes that is exposed to air (i.e. the outside area of the unfinned tubes minus the area of tubes covered by the fins).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group ExternalInterface -> text
input: What does the Field: Actuated Component Type define?
output: The field defines the type of the entity that is to be controlled by the actuator. The component types available vary with the specifics of individual models.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Baseboard Radiant Heating Rate [W]' field report?
output: This field reports the rate at which radiant heat addition is transferred from the baseboard to the people and the surfaces within the zone in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: When is the predicted latent load to humidistat setpoint heat transfer rate zero for a dual setpoint humidistat?
output: The value is zero when the controlled zone’s relative humidity is between the defined humidifying and dehumidifying setpoints.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: When is the 'Field: Fraction of Autosized Heating Design Capacity' required?
output: This input field is required when the Heating Design Capacity Method is 'FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: AirTerminal:SingleDuct:ConstantVolume:Reheat -> Inputs -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Reheat Coil Name'?
output: The 'Field: Reheat Coil Name' is the reheat Coil Object name being simulated with this ADU applicable for all coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Low Sensible Heat Ratio Function of Temperature Curve Name field used for?
output: It is the name of a biquadratic normalized curve that parameterizes the variation of the sensible heat ratio (SHR) as a function of DX cooling coil entering air wet-bulb and dry-bulb temperatures.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the default value for the dead band temperature difference if the field is left blank?
output: The default value is 5°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What should be entered for the Heating Design Capacity Per Floor Area?
output: Enter the heating capacity per unit floor area in m3/s-m2 of hot water baseboard heater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What does the outdoor air controller do if all the limits are satisfied for continuous air flow systems?
output: If the outdoor air temperature is greater than or equal to the mixed air temperature setpoint the outdoor air flow rate is set to the maximum; otherwise it modulates the outdoor air flow to match the mixed air setpoint temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> table row: Water Systems Objects
input: What is the type of water interaction for the input object 'Coil:Cooling:Water:DetailedGeometry'?
output: Condensate collection to WaterUse:Storage

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What is the output for Heat Exchanger Defrost Time Fraction?
output: The output is HVACAverageHeat Exchanger Defrost Time Fraction[].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Energy Management System (EMS) -> text
input: How are curve and table input objects used in Erl programs?
output: These objects can be used in Erl programs by setting up an Erl variable that contains an index pointing to a specific curve or table.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: How does the heater maintain the tank temperature in a cycling WaterHeater:Mixed object?
output: The heater continuously cycles on and off to maintain the tank temperature within the deadband.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What choice should be made from the method field for 'Field: Air Changes per Hour'?
output: The choice from the method field should be 'AirChanges/Hour'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What happens when the compressor(s) run continuously for the simulation timestep?
output: There are no efficiency losses when the compressor(s) run continuously for the simulation timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What does the 'Ice Thermal Storage Mass Flow Rate' represent?
output: The total water mass flow rate through the ice storage component.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: Does the 'Field: Nominal Electric Power' contribute to thermal load?
output: None of this electric power contributes thermal load to the process or regeneration air streams.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: When is the 'Storage Control Track Meter Name' field required?
output: This is required when Storage Operation Scheme is set to TrackMeterDemandStoreExcessOnSite.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the relationship between EIR and COP?
output: The EIR is the inverse of the COP.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> listing
input: What are the parameters for Site:HeightVariation?
output: The parameters for Site:HeightVariation are 0.22 for Wind Speed Profile Exponent 370 for Wind Speed Profile Boundary Layer Thickness m and 0.0065 for Air Temperature Gradient Coefficient deltaC/m.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What determines the supply air temperature setpoint in a single zone reheat system?
output: The heating or cooling load for this zone determines the supply air temperature setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the Fuel Use Curve?
output: The Fuel Use Curve is a quadratic equation that determines the ratio of Cooling Load to Fuel Energy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What happens if the field for the Mode # System Third Fuel Consumption Lookup Table Name is blank?
output: If this field is blank Mode # does not consume a third fuel.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What object can the packaged DX system be in this configuration?
output: In this configuration the packaged DX system can be AirloopHVAC:UnitarySystem object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What influences the effective layer properties for pleated drapes?
output: The effective layer properties are influenced not just by horizontal solar profile angle but also by incidence angle.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the electricity consumption of the water pump used with evaporative cooling of the condenser?
output: This is the electricity consumption in Joules of the water pump used with evaporative cooling of the condenser for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the unit of Refrigeration Air Chiller System Total High Stage Compressor Heat Transfer Rate?
output: The unit of Refrigeration Air Chiller System Total High Stage Compressor Heat Transfer Rate is Watts (W).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Is the input field auto-sizable?
output: Yes this input field is auto-sizable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: When is the basin heater active?
output: The basin heater is active when the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature falls below this setpoint temperature as long as the tower fan is off and water is not flowing through the tower.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the average space air heat balance system air transfer rate?
output: HVACAverageSpace Air Heat Balance System Air Transfer Rate [W]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the Fan Coil Total Cooling Energy field report?
output: The total (sensible and latent) heat extraction of the fan coil unit from the zone it is serving in Joules over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text
input: How is the 'Field: Severity Schedule Name' used?
output: This is used as a multiplier to the user-defined temperature offset.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text
input: What is the minimum light output fraction for continuous or continuous-off dimming control?
output: The minimum light output fraction for continuous or continuous-off dimming control is 0.2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: Field: Pool Water Outlet Node is the name of the node on the demand side of a plant loop that leads out of the pool.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What is the primary intention of using SetpointManager:FollowGroundTemperature?
output: This setpoint manager is primarily intended for condenser or plant loops using some type of ground heat exchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What do runs 2 through 9 demonstrate?
output: Runs 2 through 9 are just stepping through the Override Modes (Mode01 to Mode08).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How many speeds are there?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What is the maximum zone heating volumetric flow rate per square meter used for?
output: This field is used when Heating Design Air Flow Method is specified as DesignDayWithLimit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: How can the design outdoor air flow rate be specified in Sizing:Zone?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate can be specified by referencing the name of a design specification outdoor air object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What must the name correspond to in a DesignSpecification:ZoneHVAC:Sizing object?
output: The name must correspond to a unique name of a DesignSpecification:ZoneHVAC:Sizing object defined elsewhere.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Gross Rated Cooling COP'?
output: The coefficient of performance is the ratio of the gross total cooling capacity in watts to electrical power input in watts of the DX cooling coil unit at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Cooling Water Inlet Node Name' field contain?
output: This field contains the name of the cold water inlet node to the radiant system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What does the Maximum Indoor Temperature Schedule Name field define?
output: This alpha field defines the name of a schedule (ref. Schedule objects) which contains the maximum indoor temperature (in Celsius) above which ventilation is shutoff as a function of time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What is the Water System Roof Irrigation Actual Depth?
output: The Water System Roof Irrigation Actual Depth is the actual amount of irrigation for the green roof (ecoroof) based on the scheduled user input and moisture state/saturation of the soil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: When is the Site:WeatherStation object useful?
output: It is useful when working with a custom weather file that includes data not measured at the WMO standard conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How are all surfaces modeled in EnergyPlus?
output: All surfaces are modeled as a thin plane (with no thickness) except that material thicknesses are taken into account for heat transfer calculations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: According to which standards will EER IEER and Standard Rating (Net) Cooling Capacity be calculated for cooling capacities between 65000 and 135000 Btu/hr?
output: These will be calculated according to ANSI/AHRI standard 340-360 (2013).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Does the CoilSystem:Cooling:Water object require a Controller:WaterCoil?
output: The CoilSystem:Cooling:Water object does not require Controller:WaterCoil and relies on a built-in controller.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What kind of curve is discussed in the subsection 'Curve:QuadraticLinear'?
output: This curve is a function of two independent variables.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: Where is the convective heat gain from people added?
output: The convective heat gain from people is added to the zone air heat balance directly.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the VRF Heat Pump Defrost Electricity Rate?
output: It is an average HVAC output variable measured in Watts (W).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What is the Site Direct Solar Radiation Rate per Area?
output: It is the amount of solar radiation received within a 5.7-degree field of view centered on the sun also known as Beam Solar and expressed in W/m^2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What does the 'Schedule Name' field represent in the inputs for the decay source model?
output: This field is the name of the schedule (ref: Schedule) that modifies the maximum design emission rate (G\(_f\)). This fraction between 0.0 and 1.0 is noted as F\(_G\) in the above equation. When the value is equal to 1 the generation rate is used and time is reset to zero. When the value is equal to zero the schedule value is ignored in the equation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What is the type of condensation control?
output: The condensation control type is SimpleOff.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: Can the window be an airflow window?
output: The window cannot be an airflow window i.e. a window that has an associated WindowProperty:AirflowControl.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Equipment -> text
input: What fields are associated with each item in the ZoneHVAC:EquipmentList?
output: Each item in the list has four fields: Object Type Name Cooling Sequence and Heating or No-Load Sequence.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the frost control type specified in HeatExchanger:AirToAir:SensibleAndLatent?
output: MinimumExhaustTemperature

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> equation
input: What is the equation for thermal radiation heat transfer to surrounding surfaces?
output: Q = Hr * A * (T_surf - T_srdsurfs)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the 'Fuel Energy Input Ratio Function of Temperature Curve name' field?
output: The field is the curve name for the fuel energy input ratio as a function of the two independent temperature values (air and water).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Setpoint Node or NodeList Name'?
output: This is an alpha field that is the name of a NodeList object containing the names of the HVAC system nodes or the name of a system node for which temperature setpoints will be established by this setpoint manager.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Control -> text
input: Where is the source side of this component expected to be located?
output: The source side of this component is expected to be located on the demand side of a secondary chilled water plant on the demand side outlet branch.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the field 'Chilled Water Outlet Node Name' represent?
output: This alpha field contains the identifying name for the district cooling outlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What happens when the throttling range is set to zero?
output: When the throttling range is set to zero it approximates an on-off system that is either fully on or totally off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What can users do to reduce simulation time in EnergyPlus?
output: Users may choose to enter a lesser number than the default of 20 for the maximum number of iterations or a bigger number for certain buildings.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What factors determine the cooling rate in the radiant system?
output: The cooling rate is determined by the zone conditions the control scheme defined in the user input and the timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How can shades and screens be applied to a subsurface?
output: Shades and screens may be applied by referencing this subsurface in a window shading control (ref: WindowShadingControl object).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is the nominal time for condensate removal to begin for Speed 1 of the heat pump ACDXCoil 1?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> listing
input: What is the example input for a single-speed heating DX coil with secondary DX coil run option?
output: Coil:Heating:DX:SingleSpeed  Heat Pump DX Heating Coil 1 !- Name  FanAndCoilAvailSched  !- Availability Schedule Name  autosize        !- Gross Rated Heating Capacity W  2.75          !- Gross Rated Heating COP W/W  autosize        !- Rated Air Flow Rate m3/s  773.3          !- 2017 Rated Supply Fan Power Per Volume Flow Rate W/(m3/s)  934.4          !- 2023 Rated Supply Fan Power Per Volume Flow Rate W/(m3/s)  Heating Coil Air Inlet Node !- Air Inlet Node Name  SuppHeating Coil Air Inlet Node !- Air Outlet Node Name  HPACHeatCapFT      !- Heating Capacity Function of Temperature Curve Name  HPACHeatCapFFF     !- Heating Capacity Function of Flow Fraction Curve Name  HPACHeatEIRFT      !- Energy Input Ratio Function of Temperature Curve Name  HPACHeatEIRFFF     !- Energy Input Ratio Function of Flow Fraction Curve Name  HPACCOOLPLFFPLR     !- Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name              !- Defrost Energy Input Ratio Function of Temperature Curve Name  -5.0          !- Minimum Outdoor Dry-Bulb Temperature for Compressor Operation C              !- Outdoor Dry-Bulb Temperature to Turn On Compressor C  5.0           !- Maximum Outdoor Dry-Bulb Temperature for Defrost Operation C  200.0          !- Crankcase Heater Capacity W  10.0          !- Maximum Outdoor Dry-Bulb Temperature for Crankcase Heater Operation C  Resistive        !- Defrost Strategy  TIMED          !- Defrost Control  0.166667        !- Defrost Time Period Fraction  autosize        !- Resistive Defrost Heater Capacity W  4            !- Region number for calculating HSPF (2017) and HSPF2 (2023)              !- Evaporator Air Inlet Node Name  NORTH ZONE       !- Zone Name for Evaporator

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What must be specified for the 'Cooling Design Capacity' field to be autosized?
output: A design day sizing run must be specified for this to be autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What should be entered for the Fraction of Autosized Heating Design Supply Air Flow Rate?
output: Enter the heating supply air volume flow rate as a fraction of the autosized heating supply air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> listing
input: What is the name of the air terminal unit in the example?
output: Zone 1 SPIU ATU

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: Can additional fields be added to the object described?
output: Yes this object is extensible so additional fields of this type can be added to the end of this object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What might result in nonsensical results in situations where results are sensitive to window or glass door position?
output: This includes shadowing on the window/glass door daylighting from the window/glass door and interior distribution of solar radiation from the window/glass door.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What is the field name for the mechanical zone fan circulation vertical wall equation user curve?
output: Field: Mechanical Zone Fan Circulation Vertical Wall Equation User Curve Name

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What is the 'x' variable in the curve for 'Hn Function of Temperature Difference Curve Name'?
output: The curve's 'x' is the absolute value of delta-T (Surface temperature minus air temperature in Celsius).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> text
input: How many BuildingSurface:Detailed objects can a single collector be associated with?
output: A single collector can be associated with as many BuildingSurface:Detailed objects as desired since this object is extensible.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What does the numeric field 'Maximum Outdoor Air Temperature in Heating Mode' define?
output: The numeric field 'Maximum Outdoor Air Temperature in Heating Mode' defines the maximum outdoor temperature allowed for heating operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: When are the outdoor air load variables calculated?
output: The outdoor air load variables are only calculated when there is active heating or cooling (or humidification/dehumidification).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: When does the basin heater operate?
output: The basin heater operates only when the DX coil is off regardless of the basin heater schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What type of chiller is used in the example?
output: Heat Recovery Chiller

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What optional objects can the 'SurfaceProperty:LocalEnvironment' object link to?
output: A schedule object a SurfaceProperty:SurroundingSurfaces object an OutdoorAir:Node object and a SurfaceProperty:GroundSurfaces object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Number of Enhanced Dehumidification Modes' field define?
output: This integer field defines the number of enhanced dehumidification modes available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> table row: WaterHeater:Mixed
input: What is the heater thermal efficiency for the mixed water heater?
output: The heater thermal efficiency is 0.98.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What type of fan is the AirflowNetwork:Distribution:Component:Fan?
output: AirflowNetwork:Distribution:Component:Fan is Fan:VariableVolume only.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the Zone Ventilator Sensible Cooling Rate calculated?
output: This value is calculated using the supply air outlet mass flow rate and the enthalpy difference of the supply outlet and exhaust inlet air streams at a constant humidity ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What is the default value for the DC to AC size ratio?
output: The default value of the DC to AC size ratio is 1.10.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How should the sensible and total cooling capacities be defined for the Rated SHR?
output: Both the sensible and total cooling capacities used to define the Rated SHR should be gross (i.e. the effect of supply air fan heat is NOT accounted for).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What happens if the 'Mode 0 Supply Fan Electric Power Lookup Table Name' field is blank?
output: If this field is blank Mode 0 does not consume electricity for supply fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: How are distribution transformers classified according to the input voltages?
output: According to the input voltages distribution transformers can be classified into medium-voltage (between 600 V and 34.5kV) and low-voltage transformer (less than 600 V).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does an Availability Manager Assignment List provide?
output: An Availability Manager Assignment List is a list of Availability Managers giving both Availability Manager type and name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the latent energy field represent in refrigeration cases?
output: This field is the amount of latent cooling (dehumidification) case credit energy delivered to the zone in Joules. If an under case return duct is simulated only a portion of the latent case credits are applied to the zone. A negative value (or zero) will be reported when the refrigerated case provides dehumidification (thereby reducing the zone latent load).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: Is the 'Reheat Coil Name' field applicable for all coils?
output: Yes it is applicable for all coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> equation
input: What is the crack air flow equation?
output: Q = (Crack Factor) * C_T * C_Q (ΔP)^n

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Overcool Control Ratio field?
output: The value of this input field is used to adjust the cooling setpoint temperature downward based on the difference between the zone air relative humidity level and the Dehumidifying Relative Humidity Setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: What should the split between sensible and latent gains depend on?
output: The split between sensible and latent gains will vary depending on the type of equipment that is to be modeled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What does any other schedule value denote for the supply air fan?
output: Any other value denotes that the fan runs continuously regardless of the need for heating or cooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the 'VRF Heat Pump Condenser Outlet Temperature'?
output: This is the condenser coil outlet water temperature in degrees C. This value is calculated for each HVAC system time step being simulated and the results are averaged for the time step being reported. This value is only reported for water-cooled systems. (The use of the word 'Condenser' here is taken from cooling operation—the same device can also be an evaporator during heating operation.)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: When can the heating supply air volume flow rate as a fraction of the autosized heating supply air flow rate field be left blank?
output: This input field may be left blank if heating coil is not included in the airloop or the Heating Supply Air Flow Rate Method is not FractionOfAutosizedHeatingAirflow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> text
input: Why should Plant Supply Side Cooling Demand Rate not be summed over time?
output: Because it will overstate the demand whenever the loop is off setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> equation
input: What is the default value for the receiver pressure?
output: The default value for the receiver pressure is 4.0 × 10^6 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Is the Low Sensible Heat Ratio Function of Temperature Curve Name field optional?
output: Yes this input field is optional.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: Are any preprocessor message objects necessary if there is no error information to be passed?
output: No preprocessor message objects are necessary if there is no error information to be passed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table row: Complete list of Objects with autosized Fields
input: What is the first object name listed in the table of objects with autosized fields?
output: The first object name listed is AirConditioner:VariableRefrigerantFlow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the fan availability status determined for a packaged terminal heat pump?
output: This status flag is a result of the calculations made by the Availability Manager(s) listed in an AvailabilityManagerAssignmentList object and/or calculations made by Hybrid Ventilation Manager object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: What is the comfort height used for in the EnergyPlus model?
output: The height in meters above the floor at which air temperature is calculated for comfort purposes. The air temperature at this height is used in calculating the available measures of comfort: Fanger Pierce KSU CoolingEffectASH55 or AnkleDraftASH55. The default is 1.1 meters.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What does 'Flow/Person' mean in the context of the 'Outdoor Air Method'?
output: It means the program will use the input from the field 'Outdoor Air Flow per Person' and the actual zone occupancy to calculate a zone outdoor air flow rate. The density of air is measured at IUPAC standard temperature and pressure.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is the number of cells in the schedule?
output: The number of cells is 4.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What assignments should be used when entering the curve for refrigeration compressor capacity?
output: N1 is ARI C1 and N2 is ARI C2. N3 is ARI C4 and N4 is ARI C3. N5 is ARI C6 and N6 is ARI C5 N7 is ARI C7. N8 is ARI C10 N9 is ARI C8 and N10 is ARI C9. N11 is the Minimum evaporating temperature and N12 is the Maximum evaporating temperature. N13 is the Minimum condensing temperature and N14 is the Maximum condensing temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does Tdbo represent?
output: Tdbo represents the dry-bulb temperature of the outdoor air (C).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Heat Recovery Inlet High Temperature Limit Schedule Name' field?
output: It can be used to control heat recovery operation of the chiller by providing an upper limit for the return fluid temperatures entering the chiller at the heat recovery inlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Speed <x> Reference Unit Rated Condenser Air Flow Rate' field define?
output: This numeric field defines the condenser volumetric air flow rate in \\si\\volumeFlowRate across the condenser coil at rated conditions for Speed <x> operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the rated volumetric air flow to gross total cooling capacity ratio for 100% dedicated outdoor air (DOAS) application DX cooling coils?
output: The rated volumetric air flow to gross total cooling capacity ratio for 100% DOAS application DX cooling coils should be between 0.00001677 (m3/s)/W (125 cfm/ton) and 0.00003355 (m3/s)/W (250 cfm/ton).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Coefficient2 x'?
output: The coefficient C\\(_2\\) in the equation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: To which meter is the electric consumption of the desuperheater heating coil parasitic load added?
output: This output is added to a meter with Resource Type = Electricity End Use Key = Heating Group Key = System (ref. Output:Meter objects).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Demand Limiting Controls -> text
input: What does the 'RotateOne' option do in the Selection Control field?
output: The 'RotateOne' limits only one load which rotates sequentially through the loads listed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What happens if the chiller is both heating and cooling in terms of electricity usage?
output: Only the greater of the computed cooling and heating electricity is used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the Surface Window Solar Horizontal Profile Angle for a vertical exterior window?
output: For a vertical exterior window the Surface Window Solar Horizontal Profile Angle is the angle appropriate for calculating beam solar quantities for horizontal window elements and is defined as the angle between the window outward normal and the projection of the sun's ray on the vertical plane containing the outward normal.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> equation
input: What would be the resulting Fouling Factor if the schedule has a value of 1.2 and the Fouling Factor is 0.8?
output: If the schedule has a value of 1.2 it implies 20% more fouling: if the Fouling Factor is 0.8 then resulting Fouling Factor would be 0.8 / 1.2 = 0.67.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What options are available for the 'Field: Heating Design Capacity Method'?
output: The options are HeatingDesignCapacity CapacityPerFloorArea and FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Ventilation Type' define?
output: This alpha character string defines the type of ventilation as one of the following options: Natural Exhaust Intake or Balanced.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What does a value of 2 indicate in the Availability Manager Scheduled Control Status?
output: A value of 2 means the manager is signaling CycleOn.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What does the Zone Air Terminal Current Operation Control Stage field report?
output: This field reports the current control stage of a PIU terminal.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Unitary System Electricity Energy' output field represent?
output: This output field is the electricity consumption of the multispeed heat pump in Joules for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the type of rate measured for Zone Steam Equipment Radiant Heating?
output: Rate [W]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the method used with the 'Flow/Person' choice?
output: With this choice the method used will be a factor per nominal number of people in the zone. (The Flow Rate per Person field should be filled.)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What are the outputs when storage tank water is used for make-up water?
output: HVACAverageCooling Tower Make Up Water Volume Flow Rate [m3/s]; HVACSumCooling Tower Make Up Water Volume [m3]; HVACSumCooling Tower Storage Tank Water Volume Flow Rate [m3/s]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Design Fan Power' field contain?
output: This numeric field contains the fan power (in watts) at the design air flow rate specified in the previous field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What do building energy codes and standards like ASHRAE 90.1 90.2 and California Title 24 require for underground wall constructions and slabs-on-grade?
output: They require the underground wall constructions and slabs-on-grade or underground floors not to exceed certain maximum values of C-factor and F-factor which do not specify detailed layer-by-layer materials for the constructions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the purpose of the StorageTank mode in the Source Side Flow Control Mode?
output: The mode called StorageTank is for a passive tank and it always requests flow unless the tank temperature is equal to or higher than the maximum limit given in the input field called Maximum Temperature Limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the format of the IDF example provided?
output: ZoneContaminantSourceAndSink:Generic:Constant NORTH ZONE GC !- Name NORTH ZONE !- Zone Name 1.0E-6 !- Design Generation Rate m3/s GC Source Schedule !- Generation Schedule Name 1.0E-7 !- Design Removal Coefficient

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the first step mentioned in the text for selecting input?
output: Select Dimensionless.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: Can the performance characteristics at the rating point be modified by the user?
output: Yes the performance characteristics at the rating point are not fixed in the program and can be entered by the user when they differ from default values.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the VRF Heat Pump Cooling Electricity Rate?
output: This output field is the cooling mode electricity consumption rate of the variable refrigerant flow heat pump in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What does this type of modeling allow in terms of heat transfer calculations?
output: It allows using the usual heat transfer calculations for the underlying surface with other types of multi-skin component models that are available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> table row: Surface Inside Face Convection Model Equation Index
input: What is the related key and model for Report Code 212?
output: KhalifaEq3WallAwayFromHeat

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table: Design Objects
input: What is the first parameter for 'WaterHeater:Mixed'?
output: Tank Volume

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> equation
input: What is the defining equation for the Steam Input Ratio?
output: The defining equation is: SteamInputRatio = \\fracC1PLR + C2 + C3 * PLR

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the section 'Site:GroundDomain:Slab' document?
output: This section documents the input object used to simulate ground coupled heat transfer with horizontal building surfaces within EnergyPlus.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: How is the chiller modeled in EnergyPlus for the Parallel configuration?
output: The chiller must be modeled using two different chiller objects to represent the same chiller. One chiller object on a parallel branch operates only when storage is not being charged. The other chiller object in series upstream of the storage unit operates only during charging mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> equation
input: What is the equation for the Capacity Ratio Curve?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What conditions define the rated conditions for the high speed gross rated cooling COP?
output: The rated conditions are air entering the cooling coil at 26.7°C drybulb/19.4°C wetbulb air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35°C drybulb/23.9°C wetbulb and a cooling coil air flow rate defined by field rated air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> equation

output: The curves are usually derived from fits or regressions to data covering a limited range.
