instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What does 'Field: Input Unit Type for Y' specify?
output: This field is used to indicate the kind of units that may be associated with the y values. It is used by IDF Editor to display the appropriate SI and IP units for the Minimum Value of Y and Maximum Value of Y. The unit conversion is not applied to the coefficients.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What is the purpose of the numeric field labeled 'Efficiency'?
output: This numeric field is used when the Design Power Sizing Method is set to TotalEfficiency and the Design Electric Power Consumption is set to Autosize. It is used to determine the Design Electric Power Consumption from the Design Maximum Air Flow Rate and the Design Pressure Rise.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What do the 'Baseboard Steam Energy [J]' and 'Baseboard Steam Rate [W]' paragraphs describe?
output: They describe the total heat addition energy and rate of steam used by the baseboard to heat the zone it is serving in Joules and Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How are the results for the 'Zone Water to Air Heat Pump Sensible Cooling Energy' summed?
output: This value is calculated for each HVAC system time step being simulated and the results (cooling only) are summed for the time step being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Storage Control Track Meter Name'?
output: This field is the name of a meter to use when a custom meter is to be used required when Storage Operation Scheme is set to TrackMeterDemandStoreExcessOnSite.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What does the transmitted radiation consist of for a window with a screen in terms of beam-to-beam transmission?
output: For a window with a screen this value consists of direct beam radiation that is transmitted through the screen (gaps between the screen material).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What can be successfully used if certain points and suggestions are followed?
output: Mixed user-specified and autosized inputs can be successfully used if certain points and suggestions are followed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field Set: Inlet Node Outlet Node Mixed Air Node Zone Node'?
output: This object is extensible so the following four fields can be repeated as needed. One set is used for each outdoor air system that is connected to the collector.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: What does the 'Water Quality Subcategory' field describe?
output: Describes the quality of the water contained in the tank. Used for reporting and to check that the uses and supply match the category of water quality.

input: What is the Emissivity of Inner Cover in the example?

output: Fractional values in the basic schedule will be applied to the design level field below.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What are the benefits of using the Multiplier field?
output: Using Multiplier can save input effort and calculation time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the heating or cooling output of the fan coil unit controlled?
output: It is controlled by varying the air flow rate the water flow rate or both.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the Cooling Tower Make Up Mains Water Volume represent?
output: This is the volume of water drawn from mains service to feed the cooling tower.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the total cooling rate output of the terminal unit determined?
output: It is determined by terminal unit inlet and outlet air conditions and the air mass flow rate through the unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What is the benefit of using the Warmest Setpoint Manager strategy compared to a fixed cooling supply air temperature setpoint?
output: This strategy minimizes zone reheat coil energy (or overcooling) and central chiller energy consumption (if the chilled water temperature is also reset) at the cost of possible increased fan energy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Hollow Core Length' field specify?
output: This field specifies the length of core embedded in the surface named above in the surface name field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is 'Chiller Heater Condenser Heat Transfer Energy [J]'?
output: The condenser heat transfer energy is the heat rejected from the chiller heater to either a condenser water loop or through an air-cooled condenser. The values are calculated for each HVAC system time step being simulated and the results are summed across the reporting period. Chiller Heater Condenser Heat Transfer Energy is metered on HeatRejection:EnergyTransfer EnergyTransfer:Plant and EnergyTransfer:Facility.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Where are the inlet and outlet nodes for the DX heat pump system defined?
output: The inlet and outlet nodes for the DX heat pump system are defined in the heating coil object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What happens if the Control Type is specified as SingleZoneVAV and the No Load Supply Air Flow Rate field is autosized?
output: The no load supply air flow rate is set equal to 0.5 or 0.667 times the maximum flow rate for water or coils respectively.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the air mass in kg entering the zone due to mixing?
output: The air mass in kg entering the zone is due to the sum of mixing cross-mixing and refrigeration-door mixing during the hour or timestep. The air mass is calculated using the air volume flow from each 'source' zone and the density of air calculated for the average conditions (temperature and humidity) between the 'source' and 'receiving' zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

input: What does the method PowerPerFlowPerPressure take into account?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

output: The only valid DX heating coil type is Coil:Heating:DX:VariableRefrigerantFlow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What can the model predict regarding the cooling towers?
output: The model can be used to predict water consumed by the towers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Pipe Inner Diameter' field specify in the buried piping system object?
output: This numeric field is the inner diameter of the pipe. The same pipe properties are used for all pipes in this heat exchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What does 'Space ITE Any Air Inlet Operating Range Exceeded Time' measure?
output: 'Space ITE Any Air Inlet Operating Range Exceeded Time' measures the time in hours (hr) when any air inlet exceeds the operating range.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What happens once steady periodic behavior is reached in the model?
output: Once steady periodic behavior is reached the ground temperatures are cached for retrieval during the rest of the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> text
input: What is the consumption for cooling coil chilled water?
output: Consumption for cooling coil chilled water (both purchased and plant supplied) (Joules)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: What happens in newer versions if the Site:Precipitation object is not defined?
output: If the Site:Precipitation object is not defined precipitation depth in the weather input .epw will be used instead and a warning message will be displayed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What does the alpha field 'Name' contain?
output: This alpha field contains the identifying name for the unitary system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the optional alpha input field specify for the Mode # System Water Use Lookup Table Name?
output: This optional alpha input field specifies the name of a Table:Lookup object that describes water consumption for Mode # as a function of six independent variables: outdoor air temperature outdoor air humidity ratio return air temperature return air humidity ratio supply air mass flow rate and outdoor air fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> listing
input: What is one of the outputs listed related to total heating rate?
output: One of the outputs listed is 'HVACAverageZone Hybrid Unitary HVAC System Total Heating Rate [W]'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Tank Element Control Logic' define?
output: This alpha field defines settings for the control logic of when to run the tank element in relation to whether the heat pump is running.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the 'Refrigeration System Total Cases and Walk Ins Heat Transfer Rate [W]' output represent?
output: This output is the total heat transfer rate from the refrigerated cases and walk-ins served directly by this system in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Coil Option Type' field allow the user to specify?
output: This field allows the user to specify the coil operating options as one of the following options: None Heating Cooling HeatingAndCooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What information does the 'Drift Loss Percent' field contain?
output: This numeric field contains the percent (%) of design water flow rate lost to the atmosphere at the design air flow rate due to drift.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the 'Zone Air Terminal Beam Sensible Cooling Rate'?
output: Sensible cooling by the beams in the zone exclusive of any cooling or heating done by the supply air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What needs to be changed when using TIM layers with the Solution Algorithm?
output: The Solution Algorithm needs to be changed to CondFD.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: How is the flow rate determined when autosizing the 'Field: Design Heat Recovery Water Flow Rate'?
output: The flow rate is the product of the design condenser flow rate and the Condenser Heat Recovery Relative Capacity Fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: How is total airflow across the surface calculated in the AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:HorizontalOpening object?
output: The total airflow across the surface is equal to the airflow based on the surface geometry multiplied by the subsurface multiplier.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the Field: Nominal Pumping Power represent for Chiller:Absorption?
output: This numeric field contains the nominal pumping power of the absorber in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the Velocity Squared Term Coefficient in the infiltration equation?
output: The Velocity Squared Term Coefficient is the 'D' parameter in the infiltration equation modified by the square of the speed of wind outside the building with units in s²/m².

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the purpose of calculating the ASHRAE/AHRI standard performance metrics?
output: The purpose is to assist the user in verifying their inputs for modeling this type of equipment.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Speed 3 Part Load Fraction Correlation (part load ratio)?
output: The Speed 3 Part Load Fraction Correlation (part load ratio) is HPACCOOLPLFFPLR Speed 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is a DX coil performance object referenced by another object?
output: Any reference to this DX coil performance object by another object will use the name assigned in the 'Field: Name'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What should the curve output do as the part-load ratio decreases?
output: The curve output should decrease from 1 towards 0 as part-load ratio decreases.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What is the maximum setpoint temperature in the given setpoint temperature configuration?

output: Maximum Outdoor Air Flow Rate

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: It is intended to give the user the opportunity to list surfaces visible from a radiation standpoint and define angle factors for each surface.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

output: For each component field that has been autosized the object type object name field description with unit and value are printed out as comma-separated data on a line beginning with Component Sizing.

output: deg C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the slat diffuse-diffuse solar transmittance of the WindowMaterial:Blind:EquivalentLayer?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text
input: What is 'Site Exterior Horizontal Beam Illuminance'?
output: Beam illuminance on an unobstructed horizontal plane at the earth's surface. Equals 'Site Exterior Beam Normal Illuminance times sine of solar altitude.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: Is there a need to size the converter when using SimpleFixed?
output: There is no need to size the converter (with a value in the field called Design Maximum Continuous Input Power) and varying levels of power do not affect the efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What are the choices for the Field: Fan Placement?
output: This alpha field has two choices: BlowThrough or DrawThrough. The first choice represents a blow through system where the supply air fan is before the WaterToAirHeatPump cooling/heating coil and the supplementary heating coil. The second choice represents a draw through system where the supply fan is between the WaterToAirHeatPump cooling/heating coil and the supplementary heating coil. If this input field is left blank the default is blow through.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What happens if the adjacent zone option is used for the 'Outside Boundary Condition Object' field?
output: The adjacent wall is automatically generated in the adjacent zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What do the fan speed ratio reports indicate?
output: The fan speed ratio reports indicate that 1.0 is max 0.0 is min and any value in between as it is averaged over the timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> text
input: What does the plant loop demand calculation scheme determine?
output: The plant loop demand calculation scheme determines the amount of heating or cooling necessary to bring the temperature of the Plant Loop to its setpoint(s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What does the numeric field 'No Load Supply Air Flow Rate' define?
output: It defines the supply air flow rate leaving the furnace in cubic meters per second when neither cooling or heating is required.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> listing
input: What is the air terminal unit supply air inlet node in the example?
output: Zone 1 PIU Pri Air Inlet Node

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: How should coordinates be entered when using the 'GeometryTransform' object?
output: The coordinates must be entered in relative coordinates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the unit for Space Steam Equipment Convective Heating Rate?
output: The unit for Space Steam Equipment Convective Heating Rate is Watts (W).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the default value for the rated power of the evaporative condenser water pump at low compressor/fan speed?
output: The default value for this input field is zero but it is autosizable (equivalent to 0.001422 W per watt [5 W/ton] of rated high-speed total capacity).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Can the basin heater operate when the DX coil is on?
output: Regardless of the schedule the basin heater may only operate when the DX coil is off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is the 'Cooling Tower Heat Transfer Rate'?
output: 'Cooling Tower Heat Transfer Rate' is the rate at which heat is removed from the condenser water loop by the tower.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the condenser type in the example?
output: EvaporativelyCooled

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Design Level Calculation Method' describe?
output: It is a key/choice field that tells which of the next three fields are filled and is descriptive of the method for calculating the nominal lighting level in the Zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the operating mode of the fan in the series powered induction unit?
output: The fan runs at a constant volume flow rate whenever the unit is on (and the fan's availability schedule is on or it is activated by an availability manager).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Field: No Load Fraction of Autosized Heating Supply Air Flow Rate' define?
output: This numeric field defines the fraction of autosized supply air flow rate leaving the unitary system when neither cooling nor heating coil is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> table: Report Code & Related key and model
input: What is the report code for 'AwbiHattonHeatedWall'?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: How does the program calculate the heating capacity when the Heating Design Capacity Method is CapacityPerFloorArea?
output: The program calculates the heating capacity from the floor area of the zone served by hot water baseboard heater and the heating capacity per unit floor area value specified by the user.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' in the input section?
output: The 'Field: Name' is a unique user-assigned name for an instance of a refrigeration secondary system. Any reference to this refrigeration secondary system by another object will use this name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the output of the supply air humidity ratio?
output: The output is the average over the reporting period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the 'Supply Air Fan Name' field specify?
output: The 'Supply Air Fan Name' field specifies the name of a fan component that composes part of the fan coil unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What happens if 'Schedule' is used for the Ambient Temperature Indicator?
output: If Schedule is used the Ambient Temperature Schedule value provides the ambient temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Speed 4 Heating Capacity Function of Water Flow Fraction Curve Name?
output: Heating VS WaterFrac Test

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the typical efficiency for the electric heating coil?
output: In most cases for the electric coil this will be 100%.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What components can a zone outdoor air unit consist of?
output: A zone outdoor air unit can consist of a supply fan an exhaust fan (optional) heating and cooling coils and heat recovery.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the 'Refrigeration Transcritical System Refrigerant Mass Flow Rate' indicate?
output: This output is the calculated refrigerant mass flow rate through the high pressure compressors for this system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the output variable for chiller condenser heat transfer energy?
output: HVACSumChiller Condenser Heat Transfer Energy [J]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Evaporative Coolers -> text
input: How is the design effectiveness modified in the ResearchSpecial model?
output: The design effectiveness is modified by multiplying with Effectiveness Flow Fraction Modifier Curve value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Schedule Name' in the SteamEquipment object?
output: This field is the name of the schedule that modifies the design level parameter for steam equipment.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What are the options for heating in VAV systems?
output: Heating can usually be provided by use of reheat coils or thermostatic baseboard.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Is the 'Maximum Water Flow Rate' field autosizable?
output: This field is autosizable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Demand Limiting Controls -> text
input: What is the purpose of the DemandManager:Ventilation object?
output: The DemandManager:Ventilation object is used for limiting the ventilation rate calculated from the Controller:OutdoorAir object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Design Entering Air Temperature' field specify?
output: This numeric field contains entering air dry-bulb temperature at nominal conditions in degrees Celsius.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What outputs are provided by the cooling coil and heat exchanger?
output: Outputs are provided by the cooling coil and heat exchanger that are specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What happens if the 'Heat Recovery Cooling Energy Modifier Curve Name' field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank and heat recovery operating mode is selected the default constant modifier is 1.1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: What's different about EnergyPlus Input and Output? -> text
input: What is the format of reports with a .html extension?
output: Reports with a .html extension are 'web-browser' ready.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the definition of the 'Zone Air Terminal Outdoor Air Volume Flow Rate' output?
output: This output is the amount of outdoor air entering the zone defined as the terminal unit air volume flow rate multiplied by the fraction of outdoor air entering the air loop’s outdoor air system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> section: Outputs
input: What is one of the outputs related to low pressure compressor electricity energy?
output: ZoneSum Refrigeration Transcritical System Total High Pressure Compressor Electricity Energy [J]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Wind Pressure Coefficient Curve Name' field?
output: The 'Wind Pressure Coefficient Curve Name' field specifies the name of the wind pressure coefficient curve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Outlet Branch Name' contain for a Mixer?
output: This alpha field contains the identifying name for the Mixer Outlet Branch.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the normalization condition for the performance curve in the 'Cooling And Charge Mode Total Evaporator Cooling Capacity Function of Flow Fraction Curve Name' field?
output: The performance curve is normalized to have a value of 1.0 at the rating point which is defined to be x = 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What type of HVAC data is reported for Water Heater <Fuel Type> Rate?
output: HVACAverageWater Heater <Fuel Type> Rate is reported in Watts [W].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: How is the 'Field: Companion Cooling Heat Pump Name' used?
output: This is currently used with autosizing so that the sizing calculations can be coordinated so that the two companion heat pumps get the same design reference flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What is the ManualControl strategy?
output: ManualControl is an idealized control strategy in which the pump RPM is maintained at a scheduled value throughout the simulation abiding by other flow restrictions in the loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Height above Window or Door' indicate?
output: The 'Field: Height above Window or Door' indicates the height (in meters) above the top of the door for the overhang.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What information does the 'Heat Recovery Outlet Node Name' field provide?
output: This alpha field contains the identifying name for the heat recovery side outlet.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What variable represents the outlet temperature on the source side of a heat pump?
output: HVACAverageHeat Pump Source Side Outlet Temperature [°C]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Humidifiers and Dehumidifiers -> text
input: What is the Air Outlet Node Name field?
output: The Air Outlet Node Name field is the name of the HVAC system node to which the unit sends its outlet air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What are the fields for the 'AllDays' schedule?
output: Field 1: For: AllDays Field 2: Until: 24:00 Field 3: 0.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What is the fuel higher heating value?
output: The fuel higher heating value is 45500 kJ/kg.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the default value for the diameter of the main pipe for Discharge Gas if the field is blank?
output: If this field is blank the default value of 0.0762m is used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What happens if the 'End-Use Subcategory' field is omitted or left blank?
output: The chiller will be assigned to the 'General' end-use subcategory.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What outputs are available for HVAC related to the baseboard?
output: HVACAverageBaseboard Total Heating Rate [W] HVACSumBaseboard Total Heating Energy [J] HVACSumBaseboard Hot Water Energy [J] HVACAverageBaseboard Hot Water Mass Flow Rate [kg/s] HVACAverageBaseboard Air Mass Flow Rate [kg/s] HVACAverageBaseboard Air Inlet Temperature [C] HVACAverageBaseboard Air Outlet Temperature [C] HVACAverageBaseboard Water Inlet Temperature [C] HVACAverageBaseboard Water Outlet Temperature [C].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table: Design Objects
input: What is the fourth parameter for 'HVACTemplate:Zone:VRF'?
output: No Heating Supply Air Flow Rate

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the Field: Reheat Coil Name?
output: The name of the heating coil component which composes part of the unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the field for minimum source inlet temperature specify?
output: This optional numeric field specifies the minimum entering air or water temperature at the source inlet node. Below this value the compressor will be off. The default value is -100.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Python Plugins / Python EMS -> text
input: Does the 'Search Path N' field check the filesystem for path existence?
output: No this does not check the filesystem for path existence.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Energy Management System (EMS) -> text
input: When does the BeginZoneTimestepAfterInitHeatBalance calling point occur?
output: The BeginZoneTimestepAfterInitHeatBalance calling point occurs at the beginning of each timestep after 'InitHeatBalance' executes and before 'ManageSurfaceHeatBalance'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Evaporative Coolers -> text
input: Which curves and tables are referenced in the context of evaporative coolers?
output: Curve:RectangularHyperbola2 Curve:ExponentialDecay Curve:DoubleExponentialDecay and Table:Lookup.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> list item
input: What is the output variable for AFN Node Generic Air Contaminant Concentration?
output: HVACAverageAFN Node Generic Air Contaminant Concentration [ppm]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Schedules -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Upper Limit Value' field?
output: In this field the upper (maximum) limit value for the schedule type should be entered.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> table: Ventilation Load Output Variables
input: What is the title of the table showing ventilation load output variables?
output: The title of the table is 'Ventilation Load Output Variables'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is one of the outputs related to make-up water volume when mains water is used?
output: One of the outputs is 'HVACSumCooling Tower Make Up Water Volume [m3]'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the purpose of the field 'Input Unit Type for w'?
output: This field is used to indicate the kind of units that may be associated with the w values. It is used by IDF Editor to display the appropriate SI and IP units for the Minimum Value of w and Maximum Value of w. The unit conversion is not applied to the coefficients.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the Zone Name for Master Thermostat Location?
output: LoadPriority

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Name' field specify?
output: This field is the name of the zone in which the surface is principally located and intended to affect.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Name' field in HotWaterEquipment?
output: The name of the HotWaterEquipment object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What happens if the floor area input is positive?
output: If this field is positive then it will be used as the space floor area.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Discharge Only Mode Storage Discharge Capacity Function of Flow Fraction Curve Name field?
output: This field is the name of a separate performance curve object that parameterizes the variation of the storage discharge capacity as a function of the ratio of actual air flow rate across the cooling coil to the value of the Rated Evaporator Air Flow Rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What does the speed ratio represent when 'Yes' is entered for Apply Part Load Fraction to Speeds greater than 1?
output: When Yes is entered multiple compressors are assumed and each compressor has associated speed. The speed ratio represents how long the higher speed runs as a fraction of the system timestep and the low speed runs in a whole system timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Equipment -> text
input: What is the role of nodes in the zone equipment configuration?
output: Nodes are used to specify various air node names and flow rate fractions in the zone equipment configuration.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Energy Management System (EMS) -> text
input: What are some actuators automatically set up by?
output: Some actuators are automatically set up by the program and will not be completely user-defined.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What components make up the zone water-to-air heat pump?
output: The zone water-to-air heat pump is a compound component consisting of a fan water-to-air cooling and heating coils and a supplemental heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Minimum Supply Water Temperature Curve Name' field specify?
output: This optional alpha field specifies the name of a univariate curve or table that defines the minimum supply water temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What output variables are available when a SurfaceContaminantSourceAndSink:Generic:BoundaryLayerDiffusion object is specified?
output: The available output variables are: ZONEAverage Generic Air Contaminant Boundary Layer Diffusion Generation Volume Flow Rate [m3/s] and ZONEAverage Generic Air Contaminant Boundary Layer Diffusion Inside Face Concentration [ppm].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Design Generation Rate' denote?
output: This field denotes the full generic contaminant design generation rate (m3/s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the Maximum Wind Speed field used for?
output: This is the wind speed (m/s) above which ventilation is shut off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the default tilt angle for walls?
output: Normally walls are tilted 90 degrees and that is the default for this field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What happens if the Basin Heater Availability Schedule Name field is left blank?
output: The basin heater is available to operate throughout the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How is the view factor to the sky for diffuse solar radiation determined?
output: The view factor to the sky for diffuse solar radiation is not a user input; it is calculated within EnergyPlus based on surface orientation sky solar radiance distribution and shadowing surfaces.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What range of values is valid for the 'High Speed Evaporative Condenser Effectiveness' field?
output: Valid entries can range from 0.0 to 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What should the 'End Month' field contain?
output: This numeric field should contain the ending month number (1 = January 2 = February etc.) for the annual run period desired.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What does the AFN Zone Outdoor Air Mass Flow Rate represent?
output: This is a sum of mass flow rates from outdoors to the receiving zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Outputs -> table row: People specific outputs
input: What is the output variable for zone average people radiant heating rate?
output: ZoneAveragePeople Radiant Heating Rate [W]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: What is used at the zone level to connect to both cold and hot water?
output: WaterUse:Connections are used at the zone level to connect to both cold and hot water.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: What happens if the hot water schedule or target temperature schedule is omitted?
output: If the hot water schedule or target temperature schedule is omitted all water is delivered as cold water.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: How many jet regions does each inflow aperture have?
output: Each inflow aperture has one jet region.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What are the minimum and maximum values of x for the energy input to cooling output ratio function of temperature curve?
output: The minimum value of x is 5.0 and the maximum value is 10.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What happens when the ZoneList option is used?
output: When the ZoneList option is used the capacity multiplier is applied to each of the zones in the zone list.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> table or table row: Reheat Coil Steam Inlet
input: What is the outlet node name for the reheat coil steam?
output: SPACE1-1 Reheat Coil Steam Outlet

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the average convective latent heat loss rate in Watts to the zone air corresponding to the Zone Infiltration flows?
output: The average convective latent heat loss rate in Watts to the zone air corresponds to the Zone Infiltration flows from both AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Surface:Crack and AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Surface:EffectiveLeakageArea only averaged over the reporting period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the Nominal Speed Number for the coil?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What is the sign convention for the setpoint temperature in relation to the ground temperature?
output: A positive value will increase the resulting setpoint to higher than the ground temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What happens above the temperature defined in the 'Maximum Outdoor Air Temperature in Cooling Only Mode' field?
output: Above this temperature cooling is disabled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the default orientation for floors?
output: Floors are tilted 180 degrees and that is the default for this field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What are the minimum maximum and default values for the 'Maximum Outdoor Temperature' field?
output: The minimum value is -100.0°C the maximum value is 100.0°C and the default value is 100.0°C if the field is left blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the minimum cooling supply air humidity ratio?
output: The minimum humidity ratio of the cool supply air is 0.0077 kgWater/kgDryAir corresponding to a 10°C (50°F) dew point.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> listing
input: What is an example input for Coil:WatertoAirHP:ParameterEstimation:Heating?
output: An example input is: Coil:Heating:WaterToAirHeatPump:ParameterEstimation Heat Pump HEATING Mode AHU1 Scroll R22 0.0015 38000 3000000.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the note regarding the use of coefficients in the bicubic curve?
output: Coefficients 7 9 and 10 are typically not used and should be entered as 0 unless justified by performance data and coefficients 2 3 and 6 should not be used unless sufficient temperature data is available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How does EnergyPlus simulate heat balance between two zones?
output: EnergyPlus simulates a group of zones simultaneously and includes the heat transfer between zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table row
input: What is the zone cooling design supply air temperature in the IDF example?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the model include besides the variable-speed fan?
output: The model also includes a 'free convection' regime where cooling tower performance is modeled with the fan off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What flexibility does the user have in controlling condensation?
output: The user can utilize the next parameter to adjust the differential between the dewpoint temperature and the inlet water temperature allowing some flexibility in controlling when the panel will shutdown to avoid condensation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the choice field 'SCWH Mode Load Matching Type' specify?
output: This choice field specifies the control in the SCWH mode. The choices are CoolingLoad or WaterHeatingLoad.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: What happens if the 'Changeover Delay Time Period Schedule' field is left blank?
output: EnergyPlus will assume that no changeover delay is requested equivalent to a delay of zero.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: When is the Sizing Period Site Sky Temperature Schedule Value active?
output: This schedule value is active when any Design Day objects have/use the WeatherProperties:SkyTemperature schedule option.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the Field: DX Heating Coil Object Name define?
output: This alpha field defines the name of the terminal unit's DX heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What does 'MutuallyExclusive' mean in the context of tank element control logic?
output: 'MutuallyExclusive' means that once the tank heating element(s) are active the heat pump is shut down until the heating element setpoint is reached.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What does the EMPD model use to determine convective mass transfer coefficients?
output: The EMPD model uses existing heat and mass transfer relationships such as the Lewis relation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What does 'DesignDay' mean in the context of Heating Design Air Flow Method?
output: 'DesignDay' means the program will calculate the zone design heating air flow rate using the Sizing:Zone input data and a design day simulation without imposing any limits other than those set by the minimum outside air requirements.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: When is the heater available to operate?
output: The heater is available to operate any time the schedule value is greater than 0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What must the name in Field: Name be identical to?
output: This name must be identical to one of the Window Construction Equivalent Layer definitions in the input data file.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What might you wish to use based on the weather conditions or special knowledge of the building location?
output: You may wish to use some other change effect based on the weather conditions or special knowledge of the building location.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text
input: What must the Filename sub-field be in the second form of CFS types?
output: In this case the Filename sub-field must be a valid data file name that is associated with an existing BTDF dataset that DElight can use in its calculations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What happens if the 'Field: Availability Schedule Name' is blank?
output: If this field is blank the schedule has values of 1 for all time periods.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' in the context of exponent curves?
output: A user assigned unique name for an instance of an exponent curve. When a curve is used it is referenced by this name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> listing
input: What is the maximum value of y for the first Curve:Biquadratic?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the valid range for the air mass flow exponent?
output: The valid range is 0.5 to 1.0 with the default value being 0.65.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> equation
input: What is the equation for thermal ventilation rate if the ambient temperature is greater than the cavity air temperature and the baffle is vertical?
output: The equation is \\(\\dotV_\\textthermal = C_D A_in \\sqrt2 g \\Delta H_NPL \\left( T_amb - T_acav \\right) / T_amb\\).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Sensible Heat Ratio Function of Temperature Curve Name parameterize?
output: The Sensible Heat Ratio Function of Temperature Curve Name parameterizes the variation of the sensible heat ratio (SHR) as a function of DX cooling coil entering air wet-bulb and dry-bulb temperatures.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: How does the schedule value vary compared to the design level field?
output: The schedule value can vary from hour to hour while the design level field is constant for all simulation environments.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What happens to the horizontal profile angle if the sun is behind the window?
output: If the sun is behind the window the horizontal profile angle is not defined and is reported as 0.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What are the minimum and maximum values for the 'Minimum Outdoor Temperature Schedule'?
output: The minimum temperature value in the schedule can be -100°C and the maximum value can be 100°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Under what condition does the Cooling Coil Condensate Volume Flow Rate report appear?
output: The Cooling Coil Condensate Volume Flow Rate report appears only if a water storage tank is named in the input object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Exterior Energy Use Equipment -> text
input: What is the typical use of the 'Field: Design Level'?
output: This field (Watts) is typically used to represent the maximum input to exterior fixtures that is then multiplied by a schedule fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Does the parasitic electric load contribute to heating the air?
output: The model assumes that this electric load is small and does not contribute to heating the air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Rated Inlet Water Temperature' represent?
output: It is the inlet temperature to the panel under conditions used to rate the capacity of the panel. It is used to calculate the overall heat transfer coefficient (U-Value). The default value is 5°C (41°F).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> text
input: What happens if the load for any individual component is less than the component load at the minimum PLR?
output: The individual component model will false load or reduce duty cycle while operating at the minimum part load ratio until the load is met.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What does Heat Exchanger Sensible Effectiveness measure?
output: Heat Exchanger Sensible Effectiveness measures the average sensible effectiveness of the heat exchanger (excluding bypass air if any) over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What happens if the adjacent zone option is used in the 'Outside Boundary Condition Object' field?
output: The adjacent ceiling is automatically generated in the adjacent zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What type of curve is used for the BG Shaft Power Curve?
output: A Curve:Quadratic is used for the BG Shaft Power Curve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the 'Evaporator Refrigerant Inventory' field represent?
output: It represents the refrigerant inventory on the cold (primary) side of the heat exchanger in the secondary loop in kg. The default value is zero.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does the Cooling Control Throttling Range field specify?
output: This field specifies the range of temperature in degrees Celsius over which the radiant cooling panel throttles from zero flow rate up to the maximum defined by the maximum chilled water flow rate field described above.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does \\(\\Theta_rm\\) represent in the running mean outdoor dry-bulb temperature equation?
output: \\(\\Theta_rm\\) is the current running mean outdoor dry-bulb temperature that is used to control the radiant system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: Where can more information on the interpretation of the 'Cooling High Control Temperature Schedule Name' be found?
output: For more information on its interpretation see Cooling High Air Temperature Schedule above.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What happens if a user-defined model type is selected and the specified Model Coefficient Name is not found in the input data file?
output: A severe message is issued and the simulation will terminate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> equation
input: What is the equation for FracFullLoadPower?
output: FracFullLoadPower = C_1 + C_2PartLoadRatio + C_3PartLoadRatio^2

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the unit of heat transfer and how is it calculated in the context of HVAC systems?
output: The unit of heat transfer is Joules. This value is calculated for each HVAC system time step being simulated and the results are summed for the time step being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: How does the compressor configuration affect the physical meaning of the speed ratio?
output: The physical meaning of the speed ratio is dependent on the compressor configuration defined in the field of child coil object: Apply Part Load Fraction to Speeds greater than 1. The allowed choice is either Yes or No.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: Where can the HeaderedPumps:VariableSpeed object be found?
output: Currently this object may be found only in plant loops.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What does the image 'kiva-2d-custom.png' illustrate?
output: The image 'kiva-2d-custom.png' illustrates the placement of a custom block.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What is the effect of using the 'Simple' option on convection algorithms?
output: Using the 'Simple' option on either the Outside Convection Algorithm or the Zone Outside Convection Algorithm field will result in a combined coefficient regardless of the choice chosen here.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the output variable 'Cooling Coil Air Outlet Humidity Ratio' represent?
output: The output variable is the average leaving air dry humidity ratio over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What is the Zone Average Site Mains Water Temperature measured in?
output: It is measured in degrees Celsius (C).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the Auxiliary Electric Energy Input Ratio Function of PLR Curve Name?
output: It is the Auxiliary Electric EIRFPLR which is a function of the Part Load Ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What are the constraints on the schedule value?
output: The schedule value needs to be no less than 0 and no greater than 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
