output: The Fraction Radiant value is 0.3.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text

output: The other inlet node of the zone mixer should be the same as the secondary air inlet node of the PIU.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

output: The performance values e.g. capacities COPs SHRs and flow rates at individual speed levels should be given regarding a specific unit from the Reference Unit catalog data.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What happens to the water flow when the plant is served by variable speed pumps?
output: When the plant is served by variable speed pumps the water flow through this equipment will vary.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: Three Speed SHR fTemp Spd 2

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What may a low temperature radiant system consist of?
output: A low temperature radiant system (hydronic or electric) may consist of multiple active surfaces that serve to condition the space.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: How does the 'IndirectHeatAlternateSetpoint' mode differ from the 'IndirectHeatPrimarySetpoint' mode?
output: The 'IndirectHeatAlternateSetpoint' mode is similar but it bases its control decisions on an alternate setpoint given in the following field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What does the 'Fuel Type' field determine?
output: This alpha field determines the type of fuel that the generator uses.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: According to which standard are EER IEER and Standard Rating (Net) Cooling Capacity calculated when the cooling capacity of the coil is between 65000 and 135000 Btu/hr?
output: They are calculated according to ANSI/AHRI standard 340-360 (2022).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What occurs if a tank is specified in the 'Supply Water Storage Tank Name' field?
output: If a tank is specified the tower will attempt to obtain all the water it uses from the tank but will still operate and obtain the rest of the water from the mains if the tank cannot provide all the water needed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Evaporative Coolers -> text
input: What happens if a specified tank cannot provide all the water needed by the cooler?
output: The cooler will still operate and obtain the rest of the water it needs from the mains.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: How is the reported value weighted when a Fan:OnOff object is used for AFN Zone Mixing Latent Heat Loss Rate?
output: The reported value is weighted by the system run time fraction using the calculated mixing latent loss rate during the on and off cycles for the reporting period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Control -> text
input: What is unique about this plant operation scheme?
output: This plant operation scheme is unique in that the same instance of a PlantEquipmentOperation:ChillerHeaterChangeover is named in each of the plant loops being controlled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: How is the surface of the cylinders assumed in the window screen model?
output: The surface of the cylinders is assumed to be diffusely reflecting having the optical properties of a Lambertian surface.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What must the values be for 'Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate'?
output: Values must be greater than 0 or this field is autosizable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Minimum Power Output' field?
output: This field contains a lower limit on the AC power produced by the inverter.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Overcool Range Input Method' control?
output: It controls whether the input for the overcool range is a constant value or if it is a schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the lights electricity rate?
output: The electric power input for the lights.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> text

output: SequentialLoad

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: How is the AFN Zone Mixing Latent Heat Gain Rate weighted when a Fan:OnOff object is used?
output: The reported value is weighted by the system run time fraction using the calculated mixing latent gain rate during the on and off cycles for the reporting period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text

output: Walls are usually vertical with a tilt of 90 degrees.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: Schedule or control signal value at time t [dimensionless]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: Where is this type of heat exchanger intended to be connected?
output: This type of heat exchanger is intended to be connected to the supply side of a condenser loop and can be used with any type of plant loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What must the maximum receiving temperature be in relation to the minimum receiving temperature?
output: The maximum receiving temperature when cross mixing is shutoff must be greater than or equal to the minimum receiving temperature when cross mixing is shutoff at any given time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the 'Zone Hybrid Unitary HVAC Zone Sensible Cooling Rate' calculated?
output: It is calculated as the difference between the enthalpy of dry air at the temperature of the return air and the enthalpy of dry air at the temperature of the supply air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What happens if the 'Field: Availability Schedule Name' is blank?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: How is the internal gain applied when using a Zone Name?
output: Zone Name will result in one instance of the internal gain for each Space in the Zone. If there is only one Space in the Zone then the single instance will be named <Object Name>. If there is more than one Space in the Zone then each instance will be named <Space Name> <Object Name>. The full magnitude of the gain will be split between the Spaces in the Zone apportioned by the Space floor area or occupancy depending on the input method.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> equation

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Hybrid Model -> text
input: What happens when the 'Zone Measured Air CO$_2$ concentration Schedule Name' is provided?
output: It will calculate the zone air infiltration rate assuming the HVAC system is free-floating using the zone CO$_2$ balance algorithms.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Volume Ratio field define?
output: This numeric field defines the built-in-volume ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the 'Zone Packaged Terminal Air Conditioner Latent Heating Energy [J]' calculated?
output: This value is calculated as the difference between the total energy delivered to the zone and the sensible energy delivered to the zone by the packaged terminal air conditioner. This value is calculated for each HVAC system timestep being simulated and the results (latent heat addition only) are summed for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text

output: The coefficient (A22) in the equation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Performance Tables -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' in the Table:IndependentVariable Inputs section?
output: A unique user-assigned name for an independent variables. This name is referenced by Table:IndependentVariableList objects. The name of this object may be referenced by any number of Table:IndependentVariableList objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'SCWH Mode Minimum Speed' field define?
output: This numeric field defines a minimum speed level for running the SCWH; i.e. the compressor speed will be altered between the minimum speed specified and top speed responding to the simultaneous space cooling and water heating calls.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: How is the direct beam transmittance component modeled?
output: The direct beam transmittance component is modeled using the geometry of the screen material and the incident angle of the sun to account for shadowing of the window by the screen material.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text

output: This numeric field defines the fraction of cooling capacity available when the system transitions from cooling only operation to simultaneous cooling and heating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What is the minimum allowable value of PWI in the humidity ratio equation?
output: The minimum allowable value of PWI in the humidity ratio equation is specified in the field 'Minimum Process Inlet Air Humidity Ratio for Humidity Ratio Equation'. Values of PWI less than the minimum will be replaced by this minimum when calculating the regeneration outlet air humidity ratio and a warning message will be issued. The valid range for this input field is 0.0 to 1.0.

This name will be a global variable in Erl programs and cannot duplicate any other global scope Erl variable.
